title.narrative: CARE NGO-call Syrien 2022-2023

description.narrative: To increase the ability of vulnerable households in meeting their basic needs, improving access to WASH and furthermore to increase the opportunities of self-sufficiency and in offering protective efforts against gender based violence.
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

title.narrative: Individuals affected by conflict are supported with PSS structured sessions and Child Safe Space
# of beneficiaries participated in the PSS sessions and CSS
Vulnerable communities in Hassakeh and Deir-ez-Zor governorate have improved hygiene practices

1.2.1 # of disaster/crisis-affected people supported through/by CARE who used adequate hygiene practices. 1.2.2 % of respondents who washed their hands with soap in at least 3 out of 5 critical occasions in the past 2 days
Host communities and IDPs have improved access to basic water infrastructure/facilities to serve the needs of the most vulnerable users, including women and girls

2.1.1 number of rehabilitated/ Upgraded water infrastructure. 2.1.2 number of water sources upgraded using solar systems to be used for livestock and domestic uses. 2.1.3 number of months providing operation and maintenance materials for rehabilitated water infrastructure 2.1.4 # of disaster/crisis-affected people supported through/by CARE who accessed safe drinking water

Vulnerable conflict-affected individuals in Dara’a, Hassakeh and Deir-ez-Zor Governorates have improved sustainable access to livelihoods through provision of agricultural and livestock inputs, support to SMEs and providing capacity building trainings (training and apprenticeships)

2.2.1 Number of households (male and female) supported with agricultural inputs 2.2.2 Number of households (male and female) supported with fodder & Dairy product kits 2.2.3 Number of households reached with veterinary services 2.2.4 Number of individuals participated in capacity building training and extension services. 2.2.5 Number of women participated in SME training 2.2.6 Number of women received SME grant

title.narrative: Community GBV risks are identified and mitigated while beneficiaries' access to GBV services and awareness is enhanced.

3.1.1 number of GBV Safety Audits conducted 3.1.2 number of staff attending training on GBV risk mitigation 3.1.3 number of people receiving GBV awareness 3.1.4 # of beneficiaries reached with critical protection and/or reported GBV- cases

3.3.1 NES: Target 2 audits CSS: Target 1 audit 3.3.2 NES: target 36 staff\participants will be refreshment 3.3.3 CSS Target: 100

title.narrative: Vulnerable households within targeted communities in Daraa Governorate are provided with micro-gardening kits, enabling them to increase emergency food security
1.3.1 # of Households benefitting from distribution of micro-gardening kits

Vulnerable households in Dara’a, Hassakeh and Deir-ez-Zor governorates are provided with Multipurpose Cash assistance (MPCA) and/or temporary income opportunities to enable them to meet their basic needs in the short term.
1.1.1 # of labourers (female, male) worked in CfW activities. 1.1.2 # of HHs receiving multipurpose cash assistance 1.1.3 amount of cash distributed in USD.
Vulnerable individuals affected by conflict are able to identify and positively respond to protection (GBV) concerns

# of disaster/crisis-affected people supported through/by CARE who had access to adequate lifesaving GBV prevention and response services supported through/by CARE (including, but not limited to, the clinical management of rape, psychological first aid, and referral to other services, including case management)

target.value: 988 people (awareness on GBV (Y1): 750, awareness on GBV (Y2): 100, PSS children (Y2): 128, Staff Training on GBV: 10, Safety Audit: 2 (1 in Y1 and 1 in Y2)

title.narrative: Vulnerable conflict-affected households in Dara’a, Hassakeh and Deir-ez-Zor governorates have increased ability to meet their basic needs

1.1 # of disaster/crisis-affected people supported through/by CARE who recovered household goods, assets and/or income opportunities 1.2 % people satisfied with safety, adequacy, inclusiveness, and accountability of humanitarian assistance and/or protection services provided by CARE.

target.value: 1.1 29,935 people total NES: 26,185 people CSS: 3750 people 1.2 target 80% 1.3 target 80%

title.narrative: Vulnerable conflict-affected households in Dara’a and Hassakeh and Deir-ez-Zor governorates are supported to build their self-reliance and resilience

2.1 % of livelihood participants who are better able to protect, replace, or increase their income or assets at end-line as compared to baseline (70%) 2.2 % increase in average coping strategy index scores at end-line as compared to baseline (rCSI) (50%)
